stimulusHtml: Two crates are at rest on a flat surface. A student exerts a continuous force of magnitude F on the first crate that causes the crate to accelerate over a distance d in time t. The second crate is accelerated by the same continuous force of magnitude F over the same distance d, but in half the time. The student claims that the same average power is delivered to both crates by the force. Is the claim correct? Why or why not?
choicesHtml: Yes, because the force exerted on each crate is the same.
Yes, because the work done on each crate is the same.
No, because the time the force was applied to each crate is different.
No, because the mass of each crate is different.
